clinical_question: Should patients with MTX-naïve and non-MTX csDMARDs naïve RA and moderate to high disease activity, receive long-term (≥ 3 months) low dose (≤ 10mg per day) GCs and mono- or combination csDMARDs or mono or combination csDMARDs alone?
population: Patients with MTX-naïve and non-MTX csDMARDs naïve RA and moderate to high disease activity
intervention: Mono or combination csDMARDs with long-term (≥ 3 months) low dose (≤ 10mg per day) GCs
comparator: mono or combination csDMARDs alone (i.e. without long-term GCs)
outcome: Disease activity (follow up: 2 years; assessed with: DAS28-ESR)

Risk of bias.rationales: Downgraded by one level due to serious risk of bias. Patients, personnel, and outcome assessors of non-radiographic outcomes were not blinded. Patients, personnel, and outcome assessors of radiographic outcomes were blinded

Annotation.data:
1. csDMARD (51% started with MTX and 32% with SSZ, 8% with antimalarials, 8% with gold) + long-term (>= 3 months) prednisolone (7.5mg/day)
2. csDMARD (55% started with MTX and 34% with SSZ, 4% with antimalarials, 7% with gold)

Effect.Abbreviations: CI: Confidence interval; RR: Risk ratio; MD: Mean difference; HR: Hazard Ratio
